intro: Aciphylla similis, commonly known as the New Zealand spinifex, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage that forms a low-growing mat. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing remarkable adaptations to harsh conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish or reddish, and it produces small, hard seeds. Aciphylla similis plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
